Blog.post: Anguishes unsaid, Scars unrevealed, Heartbreaks unexpressed, Fears unspoken, It’s useless letting them out, ’Cause all you’ll get instead of sympathy, Is a verdict of insanity…!

Come; visit my little lonely world, Come; listen to the maddening silence of my cell, Come, see life frozen still. Come; see my sick soul, deteriorating slowly as time goes by. Come, measure my insanity, the innocence that refuses to die. Come; take a look at my bleeding heart, Come, feel the pain of isolation. Come, take a look, but walk away, Before you go down with me…

It starts like this...First the evil spirit creeps into your soul, then it makes you commit the sin. And once its done and you realize it really wasn't you who did it you try to break free & escape the chains that you've been shackled by. But it doesn't work. You run and run, but who can free himself from his own shadow?? Eventually in a desperate attempt to set yourself free you sacrifice yourself. He runs off to imprison another soul, feeling viciously happy and triumphant. And you... End up tearing up your soul.

Love is not blind. Love is light itself. Love is the Sun shining down on you & giving you warmth. Love is the Moon casting light in the dark & showing you the way. Love is a flower in bloom, exposing its exquisite beauty that was hidden from you for a while. Love is the robin singing his song at dawn, waking you up from your slumber. Love is eternity... Love is the wine you drink from God's cup. It's the song you can't hear, and the light you can't see while you're asleep. Love is the beginning, and the end.

I'll tell u what, life is no roller-coaster ride!!! Its one hell of a bumpy ride! One in which even if u 'dont' bump into someone else u'll still have to apologize! For what?! God only knows why!!! You always owe people something even when you havent done anything wrong.... What the hell....!!!

If life is a journey, and I'm its traveller, then I'm a damn lazy one! Maybe hopeless would be a better word to use. I've got food & shelter, I even have my means of travel at all times. Only I lack the motivation to move ahead! I've had many companions along the way, most of whom I've left behind at some point, not willingly, but because I had no other choice! :( And so it seems I'm one of those travellers who can never stop, 'cause my destination is so far off...Seems absurd considering I not having enough motivation!!! I know I'm not the only one who's taken this journey, but it seems as if the others prefer to stay behind, or don't want to go where i do.Or perhaps, we don't move at the same pace! If not then...How come I always end up alone...?

Why Argue? Enough of this talk of wrong and right! We submerge ourselves in the hot debate or, rather, argument over what is good and what is bad, what is rude and what is not, what is ugly and what is beautiful. This way we deviate from the real heart of the matter. Rather, we end up arguing over a topic we never even started. Isn’t that so? How many times have you found yourself ending up talking about something you never even started? Perhaps we’re all ready to argue anytime. There's always some emotional storm deep down in our hearts waiting to blow up and break free. These furious waves are then uncontrollable and very hard to stop. The only way to give an end to it all is to let it all pour out. The most interesting part is that we are ‘all’ like this. At one point or the other we blow up and lose our temper. And, of course, we have to blame it on each other, because then our anger would not be completely gone. But, what if we just gave ourselves a break and forgot about arguing? What if we stopped fighting? Could we? Is it possible? Perhaps yes. But it wouldn't be easy. We'd have to admit how unreasonable we've been, and we’d have to admit that we were little more than stupid, that our statements were mostly baseless. There was perhaps no good reason to fight anyway. Maybe out of sheer boredom! Maybe out of malice! Or just to take revenge on someone who's hurt you. I guess the last is most likely. No? And how many times have you ended up realizing that trying to convince the other party was absolutely useless? All you did was to exhaust yourself and add to your own confusion. Even though this time you were actually right. But who cares anyway? No one sees it when you’re right but everyone sees it when you're wrong. Is that not so? And, by the way, who are we trying to convince anyway, the other person, or ourselves? …
